question: What was the lad who tended the cattle in the wood doing?
answer1: eating his noon-tide meal

question: Where did the lad eat his noon-tide meal?
answer1: in a clearing in the forest

question: What did the lad see as he was sitting there?
answer1: rat run into a juniper-bush

question: Why did the lad look for the rat?
answer1: his curiousity

question: What did the lad dream of?
answer1: He was going to find the princess on the Mount of the Golden Queen.

question: What did the lad need in order to get the princess on the Mount of the Golden Queen?
answer1: seventy pounds of iron and a pair of iron shoes

question: What happened because the lad had a dream?
answer1: He had made up his mind to find the Mount of the Golden Queen.

question: What did the princess lay in the lad's pocket?
answer1: a letter and a band of gold in his pocket

question: How did the lad feel when he found in his pocket both of the things of which he had dreamed?
answer1: surprise

question: Why did the lad drive the cattle straight home?
answer1: He had no time to attend to the cattle any longer.

question: Why did the lad buy seventy pounds of iron and a pair of iron shoes?
answer1: He needed it to save the princess.
answer2: He dreamed he would need it.

question: Where did the lad end up after walking all around the meadow?
answer1: a mount of earth from which smoke was rising

question: What did the lad ask the woman who was nine yards long?
answer1: tell him the way to the Mount of the Golden Queen

question: Who is nine yards taller than the woman?
answer1: her sister

question: What happened when the giant whistled in every direction?
answer1: All the animals came from the woods, foremost among them a bear.

question: How will the giant help the lad?
answer1: ask a bear about the Mount of the Golden Queen

question: Where did the animals come from when the giant blew his whistle?
answer1: the woods

question: Who knew where the Mount of the Golden Queen was?
answer1: the eagle

question: Why did the eagle agree to take the lad to the Mount of the Golden Queen?
answer1: The giant asked him to.

question: What did the lad and the eagle do when they reached the great iron door?
answer1: knocked

question: Who appeared to open the door and admit them?
answer1: a serving-maid

question: Why did the youth drop his golden band into the beaker?
answer1: He wanted the princess to know he was there.
answer2: He was sending a signal to the princess.

question: What happened when the youth handed the princess the letter?
answer1: The mountain turned into a most handsome castle, with all sorts of precious things, servants, and every sort of convenience, each for its own purpose.

question: How did the princess feel when the youth handed her the letter?
answer1: happy

question: What did the lad see everytime before falling asleep?
answer1: a rat
